member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.CompositionAspect
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied on a type, compose another type into that type and implements one of its interfaces.
member.remarks: Use the . method to cast the enhanced type to the newly implemented interface. This cast is verified during post-compilation.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.LaosTypeLevelAspect
member.summary: Base class for all aspects applied on types.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.LaosWeavableAspect
member.summary: Base class for aspects that can be woven.
member.remarks: Combined aspects, for instance, are not woven in themselves, and are not derived from this class.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.LaosAspect
member.summary: Base class for all aspects that are declared using custom attributes ().

remarks.para: All classes derived from should be serializable (using the custom attribute). Fields that are only used at runtime (and unknown at compile-time) should be carefully marked with the custom attribute.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.ILaosAspect
member.summary: Base interface for all laos aspects.
member.remarks: This interface has no semantics. It is expected that an aspect implements either , either .

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.LaosAspect.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new .

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.LaosAspect.GetPostSharpRequirements
member.summary: Gets the requirements of the current custom attribute.
member.returns: The requirements of the current custom attribute.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.ILaosWeavableAspect
member.summary: Base interface for all aspects that can be woven, that is, that really change the code.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Laos.ILaosWeavableAspect.AspectPriority
member.summary: Gets the weaving priority of the aspect.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Laos.LaosWeavableAspect.AspectPriority
member.summary: Gets the weaving priority of the aspect.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.ILaosTypeLevelAspect
member.summary: Defines the semantics of aspects applied to types.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.ILaosTypeLevelAspect.RuntimeInitialize(System.Type)
member.summary: Method called at runtime just after the instance is deserialized.
member.param: Type on which this instance is applied.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.ILaosTypeLevelAspect.CompileTimeValidate(System.Type)
member.summary: Method called at compile-time by the weaver to validate the application of this custom attribute on a specific type.
member.param: Type on which this instance is applied.
member.returns: true if the aspect should be applied to that , false otherwise.
member.remarks: Returning false does not emit an error. You should use a to emit errors. This method can be used to filter out types that do not need to be modified.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.ILaosTypeLevelAspect.CompileTimeInitialize(System.Type)
member.summary: Method called at compile-time by the weaver just before the instance is serialized.
member.param: Type on which this instance is applied.

remarks.para: Derived classes should implement this method if they want to compute some information at compile time. This information to be stored in member variables. It shall be serialized at compile time and deserialized at runtime.
You cannot store and serialize the parameter because it is basically a runtime object. You shall receive the at runtime by the method.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.LaosTypeLevelAspect.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new .

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.LaosTypeLevelAspect.CompileTimeValidate(System.Type)
member.summary: Method called at compile-time by the weaver to validate the application of this custom attribute on a specific type.
member.param: Type on which this instance is applied.
member.returns: true if the aspect should be applied to that , false otherwise.
member.remarks: Returning false does not emit an error. You should use a to emit errors. This method can be used to filter out types that do not need to be modified.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.LaosTypeLevelAspect.CompileTimeInitialize(System.Type)
member.summary: Method called at compile-time by the weaver just before the instance is serialized.
member.param: Type on which this instance is applied.

remarks.para: Derived classes should implement this method if they want to compute some information at compile time. This information to be stored in member variables. It shall be serialized at compile time and deserialized at runtime.
You cannot store and serialize the parameter because it is basically a runtime object. You shall receive the at runtime by the method.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.LaosTypeLevelAspect.RuntimeInitialize(System.Type)
member.summary: Method called at runtime just after the instance is deserialized.
member.param: Type on which this instance is applied.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.ICompositionAspect
member.summary: Defines the semantics of an aspect that, when applied on a type, adds an interface to this type and delegates the implementation of this interface to a third object.
member.remarks: Use the . method to cast the enhanced type to the newly implemented interface. This cast is verified during post-compilation.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.IInstanceBoundLaosAspect
member.summary: Interface implemented by aspects that are bound to an object instance, for instance to a field or to a method. Note that if the aspect is applied to a static field or method, methods of this interface are never invoked.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.IInstanceBoundLaosAspect.GetInstanceTagRequest
member.summary: Gets the Instance Tag required by this aspect.
member.returns: An , or null if no instance tag is requested by this aspect.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.ICompositionAspect.CreateImplementationObject(PostSharp.Laos.InstanceBoundLaosEventArgs)
member.summary: Method called at runtime, in the constructor of the container object, to create the composed object.
member.returns: The composed object. This interface should implement the interface returned by the method.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.ICompositionAspect.GetPublicInterface(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the type of the public interface. Called at compile time.
member.param: Type of the container object.
member.returns: The interface that should be exposed on the container object and that will be implemented by the implementation object ().

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.ICompositionAspect.GetProtectedInterfaces(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets all interfaces exposed with 'protected' visibility. Called at compile time.
member.param: Type of the container object.
member.returns: The interface that should be exposed on the container object and that will be implemented by the implementation object ().

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.ICompositionAspect.GetOptions
member.summary: Gets the weaving options.
member.returns: Weaving options.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.CompositionAspect.GetInstanceTagRequest
member.summary: Gets the Instance Tag required by this aspect.
member.returns: An , or null if no instance tag is requested by this aspect.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.CompositionAspect.CreateImplementationObject(PostSharp.Laos.InstanceBoundLaosEventArgs)
member.summary: Method called at runtime, in the constructor of the container object, to create the composed object.
member.returns: The composed object. This interface should implement the interface returned by the method.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.CompositionAspect.GetPublicInterface(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the type of the public interface. Called at compile time.
member.param: Type of the container object.
member.returns: The interface that should be exposed on the container object and that will be implemented by the implementation object ().

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.CompositionAspect.GetProtectedInterfaces(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets all interfaces exposed with 'protected' visibility. Called at compile time.
member.param: Type of the container object.
member.returns: The interface that should be exposed on the container object and that will be implemented by the implementation object ().

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.CompositionAspect.GetOptions
member.summary: Gets the weaving options.
member.returns: Weaving options.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.CompoundAspect
member.summary: Custom attribute that can be extended to develop combined aspects, i.e. aspects composed of many 'sub-aspects'. These are provided by the method, which should be overwritten.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.ICompoundAspect
member.summary: Defines the semantics of an aspect that is not woven in itself, but can provide other aspects. The current interface extends but support compile-time initialization and validation.
member.remarks: Seems combined aspects are not weavable, they don't have to be serializable.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.ILaosReflectionAspectProvider
member.summary: Interface that should be implemented by aspects that want to provide other aspects to the weaver (i.e. combined aspects, see ).

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.ILaosReflectionAspectProvider.ProvideAspects(PostSharp.Laos.LaosReflectionAspectCollection)
member.summary: Provides new aspects.
member.param: Collection into which new aspects have to be added.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.ICompoundAspect.CompileTimeValidate(System.Object)
member.summary: Method called at compile-time by the weaver to validate the application of this custom attribute on a specific target element.
member.param: Element (, or on which this instance is applied.
member.returns: true in case of success, false in case of error.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.ICompoundAspect.CompileTimeInitialize(System.Object)
member.summary: Method called at compile-time by the weaver just before the instance is serialized.
member.param: Element (, or on which this instance is applied.

remarks.para: Derived classes should implement this method if they want to compute some information at compile time. This information to be stored in member variables. It shall be serialized at compile time and deserialized at runtime.

member.summary: Provides new aspects.
member.param: Element to which the current custom attribute is applied.
Collection into which new aspects have to be added.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.CompoundAspect.CompileTimeValidate(System.Object)
member.summary: Method called at compile-time by the weaver to validate the application of this custom attribute on a specific target element.
member.param: Element (, or on which this instance is applied.
member.returns: true in case of success, false in case of error.

remarks.para: Derived classes should implement this method if they want to compute some information at compile time. This information to be stored in member variables. It shall be serialized at compile time and deserialized at runtime.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.FieldAccessEventArgs
member.summary: Arguments of field-related join points. Used by .

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.InstanceBoundLaosEventArgs
member.summary: Arguments of events bound to an instance (because they relate to a field or to a method, for instance).

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.LaosEventArgs
member.summary: Base of all event arguments used in PostSharp Laos.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.InstanceBoundLaosEventArgs.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes a new
member.param: Object instance, or null if the event relates to a static field or method.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Laos.InstanceBoundLaosEventArgs.Instance
member.summary: Gets or sets the object instance on which the method is being executed.
member.remarks: This set may be set by user code only when the instance is a value type. As usually, user code is responsible for setting an object of the right type.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Laos.InstanceBoundLaosEventArgs.InstanceTag
member.summary: Gets or sets the instance tag.

remarks.para: Not applicable (and null) if the event does relates to a static field or method.
The instance tag is a location where aspects can store custom informations (tags). This location is instance-dependent. It is implemented as an instance field.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Laos.InstanceBoundLaosEventArgs.InstanceCredentials
member.summary: Gets the credentials of the current instance.
member.remarks: Credentials allow to use protected interfaces like .

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.FieldAccessEventArgs.#ctor(System.Object,System.Object,System.Reflection.FieldInfo,System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes a new .
member.param: Accessed field instance.
Accessed instance, or null if the field is static.
Exposed field value (null for get operations).
Value currently effectively stored in the field.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Laos.FieldAccessEventArgs.FieldInfo
member.summary: Gets the field being accessed.
member.remarks: If the type declaring this field is a generic type, this property contains the concrete generic field instance.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Laos.FieldAccessEventArgs.ExposedFieldValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the field value that is exposed to the external code. Do not confuse with , which is the value effectively stored.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Laos.FieldAccessEventArgs.StoredFieldValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the field value that is effectively stored in the field location. Do not confuse with , which is the value that is 'seen' by the code.
member.remarks: Setting this property does not immediately set the underlying field. The field is typically set after the execution of advices located at the join point. This remark is important for multi-threaded applications.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Laos.FieldAccessEventArgs.DeclaringType
member.summary: Gets the type declaring the accessed field.
member.remarks: If the declaring type is generic, this property contains the concrete generic type instance being accessed.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.FlowBehavior
member.summary: Specifies how the control flow will behave once it will leave the aspect method.
member.remarks: This enumeration is used by the class.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Laos.FlowBehavior.Default
member.summary: Default flow behavior for the current method. For OnEntry or OnExit, the fault flow is , for OnException it is .

member.name: F:PostSharp.Laos.FlowBehavior.Continue
member.summary: Continue normally.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Laos.FlowBehavior.RethrowException
member.summary: The current exception will be rethrown. Available only for OnException.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Laos.FlowBehavior.Return
member.summary: Return immediately from the current method. Available only for OnEntry and OnException. Note that you may want to set the property.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.IComposed`1
member.summary: Interface implemented by composed types (i.e. types implementing an interface that is implemented, not by the type itself, but by another type composed in the first one) that want to expose their implementation.
member.typeparam: Composed interface whose implementation is made accessible.
member.remarks: This interface is optional and is implemented only when the composed type wants to expose its implementation. This interface provides a way to protect the implementation: the implementation is provided only to callers holding credentials that should have been received by the composed instance itself. A second defensive approach is to make the implementation internal.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.IComposed`1.GetImplementation(PostSharp.Laos.InstanceCredentials)
member.summary: Gets the object implementing the interface on behalf of the current instance.
member.param: Credentials provided by the current instance.
member.returns: The object implementing the interface on behalf of the current instance.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.IComposed`1.SetImplementation(PostSharp.Laos.InstanceCredentials,`0)
member.summary: Set the object implementing the interface on behalf of the current instance.
member.param: Credentials provided by the current instance.
Object implementing the interface on behalf of the current instance.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.InstanceTagRequest
member.summary: Request of an instance tag. An instance tag is an instance field where aspects can store and share information.
member.remarks: By requesting the same instance tag, many aspects can share the same instance field, so they can share information.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.InstanceTagRequest.#ctor(System.String,System.Guid)
member.summary: Initializes a new .
member.param: Preferred short name of the instance field.
Unique field identifier.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.InstanceTagRequest.#ctor(System.String,System.Guid,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new , and specifies whether the instance tag should be forced to be static.
member.param: Preferred short name of the instance field.
Unique field identifier.
true if the instance tag is forced to be static (i.e. will be shared between all instances of the target type), or false otherwise.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Laos.InstanceTagRequest.PreferredName
member.summary: Gets the preferred short name of the instance field.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Laos.InstanceTagRequest.Guid
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier of the requested field.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Laos.InstanceTagRequest.ForceStatic
member.summary: Determines whether the instance tag should be static, i.e. shared between all instances of the same target type.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.CompositionAspectOptions
member.summary: Weaving options of .

member.name: F:PostSharp.Laos.CompositionAspectOptions.None
member.summary: Default.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Laos.CompositionAspectOptions.IgnoreIfAlreadyImplemented
member.summary: Ignore this aspect (i.e. does not implement it) if the interface is already implemented (even indirectly) in a parent type.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Laos.CompositionAspectOptions.GenerateImplementationAccessor
member.summary: Implements the interface on the target type.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.IImplementMethodAspect
member.summary: Defines the semantics of an aspect that implement method without previous implementations, like abstract or external methods.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.IImplementMethodAspect.OnExecution(PostSharp.Laos.MethodExecutionEventArgs)
member.summary: Method called instead of the body of the modified method.
member.param: Event arguments specifying which method is being executed, on which object instance and with which parameters.

remarks.para: The implementation is allowed to modify output arguments passed in the array, but it is required to respect argument types (otherwise an will be thrown at runtime).

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.IImplementMethodAspect.GetOptions
member.summary: Get weaving options.
member.returns: Weaving options.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.ImplementMethodAspectOptions
member.summary: Weaving options for the aspect.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Laos.ImplementMethodAspectOptions.None
member.summary: Default.

member.param: Field on which this instance is applied.

member.summary: Method called at compile-time by the weaver to validate the application of this custom attribute on a specific field.

member.returns: true if the aspect should be applied to that , false otherwise.
member.remarks: Returning false does not emit an error. You should use a to emit errors. This method can be used to filter out fields that do not need to be modified.

member.summary: Method called at compile-time by the weaver just before the instance is serialized.
member.param: Field on which this instance is applied.

remarks.para: Derived classes should implement this method if they want to compute some information at compile time. This information to be stored in member variables. It shall be serialized at compile time and deserialized at runtime.
You cannot store and serialize the parameter because it is basically a runtime object. You shall receive the at runtime by the method.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.ImplementMethodAspect
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied to a method defined in the current assembly, replaces the implementation of this method by a call to the current custom attribute.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.ImplementMethodAspect.GetInstanceTagRequest
member.summary: Gets the Instance Tag required by this aspect.
member.returns: An , or null if no instance tag is requested by this aspect.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.ImplementMethodAspect.OnExecution(PostSharp.Laos.MethodExecutionEventArgs)
member.summary: Method called instead of the body of the modified method.
member.param: Event arguments specifying which method is being executed, on which object instance and with which parameters.

remarks.para: The implementation is allowed to modify output arguments passed in the array, but it is required to respect argument types (otherwise an will be thrown at runtime).

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.ImplementMethodAspect.GetOptions
member.summary: Get weaving options.
member.returns: Weaving options.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.InstanceCredentials
member.summary: Credentials that give access to 'protected' semantics.
member.remarks: A protected semantic is specified by an interface with public visibility, but code can only get this interface when it provides the semantics represented by the current type. Instance semantics are typically retrieved by an instance method GetInstanceCredentials, which has protected visibility. This method is implemented by PostSharp Laos automatically.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.InstanceCredentials.MakeNew
member.summary: Creates a new .
member.returns: A new .

member.name: F:PostSharp.Laos.InstanceCredentials.Null
member.summary: Gets a null (or empty) /

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.InstanceCredentials.AssertEquals(PostSharp.Laos.InstanceCredentials)
member.summary: Throws an exception if given credentials are not equal to the current one.
member.param: Other credentials.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.InstanceCredentials.op_Equality(PostSharp.Laos.InstanceCredentials,PostSharp.Laos.InstanceCredentials)
member.summary: Determines whether two are equal.
member.param: An object.
An object.
member.returns: true if equals , otherwise false.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.InstanceCredentials.op_Inequality(PostSharp.Laos.InstanceCredentials,PostSharp.Laos.InstanceCredentials)
member.summary: Determines whether two are different.
member.param: An object.
An object.
member.returns: true if is different than , otherwise false.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.InstanceCredentials.GetCredentials``1(``0)
member.summary: Gets the of a given object.
member.param: The object whose credentials are required.
member.returns: The of .
member.remarks: Calls to this method are analyzed at post-compile time and replaced by ad hoc instructions. This method has pseudo protected visibility, which means that the caller should have access to protected members of type .

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.IOnExceptionAspect
member.summary: Defines the semantics of an aspect that, when applied on a method, defines an exception handler around the whole method body and let the implementation of this interface handle the exception.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.IOnExceptionAspect.GetOptions
member.summary: Get the weaving options.
member.returns: The weaving options.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.OnExceptionAspectOptions
member.summary: Weaving options for .

member.name: F:PostSharp.Laos.OnExceptionAspectOptions.None
member.summary: Default.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.IOnFieldAccessAspect
member.summary: Defines the semantics of an aspect that, when applied on a field, intercepts all get and set operations to this field.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.IOnFieldAccessAspect.OnGetValue(PostSharp.Laos.FieldAccessEventArgs)
member.summary: Method called instead of the get operation on the modified field.
member.param: Event arguments specifying which field is being accessed and which is its current value.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.IOnFieldAccessAspect.OnSetValue(PostSharp.Laos.FieldAccessEventArgs)
member.summary: Method called instead of the set operation on the modified field.
member.param: Event arguments specifying which field is being accessed and which is its current value, and allowing to change its value.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.IOnFieldAccessAspect.GetOptions
member.summary: Gets the weaving options.
member.returns: Weaving options.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.OnFieldAccessAspectOptions
member.summary: Weaving options for the aspect.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Laos.OnFieldAccessAspectOptions.None
member.summary: Default.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Laos.OnFieldAccessAspectOptions.RemoveFieldStorage
member.summary: Specifies that the field should be removed from the declaring type.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Laos.OnFieldAccessAspectOptions.GeneratePropertyMask
member.summary: Mask isolating , and .

member.name: F:PostSharp.Laos.OnFieldAccessAspectOptions.GeneratePropertyAuto
member.summary: Specifies that a property should be generated around the field if and only if the field is exposed outside the assembly.
member.remarks: If this property is set and a public or protected field is found, the field is made private and renamed, and a property with the original name and visibility of the field is created.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Laos.OnFieldAccessAspectOptions.GenerarePropertyNever
member.summary: Obsolete.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Laos.OnFieldAccessAspectOptions.GeneratePropertyNever
member.summary: Specifies the field should never be encapsulated into a property.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Laos.OnFieldAccessAspectOptions.GeneratePropertyAlways
member.summary: Specifies that a property should be generated around the field, even if the field is not visible outside its assembly.
member.remarks: If this property is set, the field is made private and renamed, and a property with the original name and visibility of the field is created.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.IOnMethodBoundaryAspect
member.summary: Defines the semantics of an aspect that, when applied on a method, defines an exception handler around the whole method body and let the implementation of this interface be invoked before the method execution (), in the exception handling block () and after the method execution, in the finally block ().

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.IOnMethodBoundaryAspect.OnEntry(PostSharp.Laos.MethodExecutionEventArgs)
member.summary: Method executed before the body of methods to which this aspect is applied.
member.param: Event arguments specifying which method is being executed, which are its arguments, and how should the execution continue after the execution of .
member.remarks: If the aspect is applied to a constructor, the current method is invoked after the this pointer has been initialized, that is, after the base constructor has been called.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.IOnMethodBoundaryAspect.OnExit(PostSharp.Laos.MethodExecutionEventArgs)
member.summary: Method executed after the body of methods to which this aspect is applied, even when the method exists with an exception (this method is invoked from the finally block).
member.param: Event arguments specifying which method is being executed and which are its arguments.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.IOnMethodBoundaryAspect.OnSuccess(PostSharp.Laos.MethodExecutionEventArgs)
member.summary: Method executed after the body of methods to which this aspect is applied, but only when the method succesfully returns (i.e. when no exception flies out the method.).
member.param: Event arguments specifying which method is being executed and which are its arguments.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.IOnMethodBoundaryAspect.GetOptions
member.summary: Gets the weaving options.
member.returns: The weaving options.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.OnMethodBoundaryAspectOptions
member.summary: Weaving options of the aspect.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Laos.OnMethodBoundaryAspectOptions.None
member.summary: Default.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.IOnMethodInvocationAspect
member.summary: Defines the semantics of an aspect that, when applied on a method, intercepts all calls to this method.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.IOnMethodInvocationAspect.OnInvocation(PostSharp.Laos.MethodInvocationEventArgs)
member.summary: Method called instead of the intercepted method.
member.param: Event arguments specifying which method is being executed and which are its arguments. The implementation should set the return value and ouput arguments.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.IOnMethodInvocationAspect.GetOptions
member.summary: Gets the weaving options.
member.returns: Weaving options.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.OnMethodInvocationAspectOptions
member.summary: Weaving options of the aspect.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Laos.OnMethodInvocationAspectOptions.None
member.summary: Default.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Laos.OnMethodInvocationAspectOptions.WeaveSiteCall
member.summary: Specifies that the aspect should be woven at call site, i.e. call instructions are to be replaced by calls to our stub. Allows to apply aspects to methods defined out of the current assembly.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Laos.OnMethodInvocationAspectOptions.WeaveSiteTarget
member.summary: Specifies that the aspect should be woven at target site, i.e. in the method to which the aspect is applied.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Laos.OnMethodInvocationAspectOptions.WeaveSiteAuto
member.summary: Chooses automatically when the target method is defined outside the current assembly, or otherwise.

member.name: F:PostSharp.Laos.OnMethodInvocationAspectOptions.WeaveSiteMask
T:PostSharp.Laos.IProtectedInterface`1
member.summary: Gives access to a 'protected' interface.
member.remarks: A 'protected' interface has necessarily public visibility, but objects don't expose them directly. Instead, they expose them through the interface. An object that wants access to a protected interface needs to get . Since the method providing is protected, it allows an instance to control which code can have access to protected semantics.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.IProtectedInterface`1.GetInterface(PostSharp.Laos.InstanceCredentials)
member.summary: Gets a protected interface.
member.param: Credentials of the current instance.
member.returns: The implementation of the interface .

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.LaosFieldLevelAspect
member.summary: Base class for all aspects applied on fields.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.LaosFieldLevelAspect.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new .

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.LaosFieldLevelAspect.CompileTimeValidate(System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary: Method called at compile-time by the weaver to validate the application of this custom attribute on a specific field.
member.param: Field on which this instance is applied.
member.returns: true if the aspect should be applied to that , false otherwise.
member.remarks: Returning false does not emit an error. You should use a to emit errors. This method can be used to filter out fields that do not need to be modified.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.LaosFieldLevelAspect.CompileTimeInitialize(System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary: Method called at compile-time by the weaver just before the instance is serialized.
member.param: Field on which this instance is applied.

remarks.para: Derived classes should implement this method if they want to compute some information at compile time. This information to be stored in member variables. It shall be serialized at compile time and deserialized at runtime.
You cannot store and serialize the parameter because it is basically a runtime object. You shall receive the at runtime by the method.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.LaosFieldLevelAspect.RuntimeInitialize(System.Reflection.FieldInfo)
member.summary: Method called at runtime just before the instance is deserialized.
member.param: Field on which this instance is applied.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.LaosNotInitializedException
member.summary: Exception raised typically when a woven program requires PostSharp Laos to be initialized, but it was not yet initialized. This situation typically occurs when an aspect has a static constructor that has aspects on it or calls (directly or not) an aspected method.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.LaosNotInitializedException.Throw
member.summary: Throws a and write some warnings to the debugger.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.LaosNotInitializedException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Initializes a from serialized data.
member.param: Serialization info.
Streaming context.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.LaosReflectionAspectCollection
member.summary: Collection that types implementing the interface can use to provide new aspects.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.LaosReflectionAspectCollection.AddAspect(System.Reflection.MethodBase,PostSharp.Laos.ILaosMethodLevelAspect)
member.summary: Add a new method-level aspect.

Aspect.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.LaosReflectionAspectCollection.AddAspect(System.Reflection.FieldInfo,PostSharp.Laos.ILaosFieldLevelAspect)
member.summary: Add a new field-level aspect.
member.param: Target field.
Aspect.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.LaosReflectionAspectCollection.AddAspect(System.Type,PostSharp.Laos.ILaosTypeLevelAspect)
member.summary: Add a new type-level aspect.
member.param: Target type.
aspect.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.LaosReflectionAspectCollection.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Enumerates the content of this collection.
member.returns: An enumerator of where the key is the target element (, or ) and the value is the aspect.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.LaosRequirements
member.summary: Builds a object representing the requirements of PostSharp Laos in the PostSharp build process.

member.summary: Returns a object representing the requirements of PostSharp Laos in the PostSharp build process
member.returns: A object.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.LaosSerializationBinder
member.summary: Implementation of used at runtime when aspect instances are deserialized. By overriding the default binder, you can resolve assembly names differently. This can be useful if assemblies have been renamed or merged between PostSharp run and execution

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.LaosSerializationBinder.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize a new .

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.LaosSerializationBinder.Retarget(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Retarget an assembly name to a new one.
member.param: Old assembly name (in short form only).
New assembly name (in short or full form).

member.name: P:PostSharp.Laos.LaosSerializationBinder.Current
member.summary: Gets or sets the SerializationBinder used tp deserialized aspects.
member.value: A , or null to use the default one.
member.remarks: You should of course set this property before the first aspect is deserialized; that is, before the static constructor of the first enhanced type is invoked.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.MethodExecutionEventArgs
member.summary: Arguments of join points related to a method body, like those of , or .

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.MethodExecutionEventArgs.#ctor(System.Reflection.MethodBase,System.Object,System.Object[])
member.summary: Initializes a new .
member.param: Method instance being executed.
Object instance on which the method is currently executed, or null if the method is static.
Array of arguments of this method.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.MethodExecutionEventArgs.GetArguments
member.summary: Obsolete.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.MethodExecutionEventArgs.GetReadOnlyArgumentArray
member.summary: Gets a read-only array of method arguments.
member.returns: The array of method arguments, or null if the method has no arguments.
member.remarks: For performance reason, this method actually returns a writable array. However, later versions of PostSharp Laos may optimize code generation and not write back values when you use this method. If you plan to modify values, use the instead.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.MethodExecutionEventArgs.GetWritableArgumentArray
member.summary: Gets a writable array of method arguments.
member.returns: The array of method arguments, or null if the method has no arguments.
member.remarks: You should modify only arguments passed by reference (out and ref in C#). If you need to change input arguments, consider using .

member.name: P:PostSharp.Laos.MethodExecutionEventArgs.Method
member.summary: Gets the method instance being executed.
member.remarks: If the executed method is generic or if its declaring type is generic, the current property contains the generic instance being executed.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Laos.MethodExecutionEventArgs.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the method return value.
member.remarks: You can modify the return value only when the join point is located after a method execution, typically when the return value has already been set.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Laos.MethodExecutionEventArgs.Exception
member.summary: Gets the exception currently flying.
member.value: An , or null if the method is exiting normally.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Laos.MethodExecutionEventArgs.FlowBehavior
member.summary: Determines the control flow of the target method once the handler is exited.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Laos.MethodExecutionEventArgs.MethodExecutionTag
member.summary: User-defined state information whose lifetime is linked to the current method execution. Aspects derived from should use this property to save state information between different events (, and ).

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.MethodInvocationEventArgs
member.summary: Arguments of a join point related to a method invocation (or method call). Used by .

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.MethodInvocationEventArgs.#ctor(System.Delegate,System.Object[])
member.summary: Initializes a new .
member.param: Delegate representing the method being called.
Arguments passed to the method.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.MethodInvocationEventArgs.GetArguments
member.summary: Obsolete.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.MethodInvocationEventArgs.GetArgumentArray
member.summary: Gets the array of arguments being passed to the method.
member.returns: The array of arguments being passed to the method, or null if the method takes no argument.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.MethodInvocationEventArgs.Proceed
member.summary: Invokes the intercepted method.
member.remarks: Invoking this method is equivalent to invoking the with arguments from and setting to the returned value.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Laos.MethodInvocationEventArgs.Delegate
member.summary: Gets the delagate representing the method being called.

member.name: P:PostSharp.Laos.MethodInvocationEventArgs.ReturnValue
member.summary: Gets or sets the method return value.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.OnMethodBoundaryAspect
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied to a method defined in the current assembly, inserts a piece of code before and after the body of these methods. This custom attribute can be multicasted (see ).
member.remarks: This custom attribute is useful to implement "boundary" functionalities like tracing (writing a line to log) or transactions (automatically start a transaction at entry and commit or rollback at exit).

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.OnMethodBoundaryAspect.OnEntry(PostSharp.Laos.MethodExecutionEventArgs)
member.summary: Method executed before the body of methods to which this aspect is applied.
member.param: Event arguments specifying which method is being executed, which are its arguments, and how should the execution continue after the execution of .
member.remarks: If the aspect is applied to a constructor, the current method is invoked after the this pointer has been initialized, that is, after the base constructor has been called.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.OnMethodBoundaryAspect.OnExit(PostSharp.Laos.MethodExecutionEventArgs)
member.summary: Method executed after the body of methods to which this aspect is applied, even when the method exists with an exception (this method is invoked from the finally block).
member.param: Event arguments specifying which method is being executed and which are its arguments.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.OnMethodBoundaryAspect.OnSuccess(PostSharp.Laos.MethodExecutionEventArgs)
member.summary: Method executed after the body of methods to which this aspect is applied, but only when the method succesfully returns (i.e. when no exception flies out the method.).
member.param: Event arguments specifying which method is being executed and which are its arguments.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.OnMethodBoundaryAspect.GetOptions
member.summary: Gets the weaving options.
member.returns: The weaving options.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.OnFieldAccessAspect
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied to a field defined in the current assembly, intercepts all get and set operations on this field. This custom attribute can be multicasted (see ).

remarks.para: This aspect can be applied only to fields defined inside the current assembly. It is recommended that you apply this attribute only to fields with private or internal visibility.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.OnFieldAccessAspect.GetInstanceTagRequest
member.summary: Gets the Instance Tag required by this aspect.
member.returns: An , or null if no instance tag is requested by this aspect.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.OnFieldAccessAspect.OnGetValue(PostSharp.Laos.FieldAccessEventArgs)
member.summary: Method called instead of the get operation on the modified field.
member.param: Event arguments specifying which field is being accessed and which is its current value.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.OnFieldAccessAspect.OnSetValue(PostSharp.Laos.FieldAccessEventArgs)
member.summary: Method called instead of the set operation on the modified field.
member.param: Event arguments specifying which field is being accessed and which is its current value, and allowing to change its value.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.OnFieldAccessAspect.GetOptions
member.summary: Gets the weaving options.
member.returns: Weaving options.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.OnMethodInvocationAspect
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied to a method, intercepts all calls to this method. The aspect implementation receives a delegate to the called method and the array of arguments.

remarks.para: This aspect creates a stub for each method to which it is applied. The stub instantiates a delegate to the original method, then it calls the method of the aspect implementation and passes the delegate as a part of the event arguments ().
This aspect can be woven at two location:

item.description: Each call instruction to the aspected method is replaced by a call to our stub. This allows to intercept calls to methods defined in another assembly than the current one. However, since it does not modify the target method, calls from other assemblies will not be intercepted. This weaving site is generally not useful when applied to methods defined in the current assembly.

The method itself is modified, so the aspect will be applied even when the method will be called from a different assembly. Actually, the body of the original method is moved into a new method, and the original method is replaced by the stub. That is, the original method becomes the stub and the new method contain the original method body, By default, all custom attributes defined on the original method are moved to the new method. The custom attribute controls which custom attribute should stay on the original method.

remarks.para: The default behavior is to use the Call Site strategy for methods defined in an external assembly, and Target Site for methods defined in the current assembly. This behavior can be changed by overwriting the method.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.OnMethodInvocationAspect.OnInvocation(PostSharp.Laos.MethodInvocationEventArgs)
member.summary: Method called instead of the intercepted method.
member.param: Event arguments specifying which method is being executed and which are its arguments. The implementation should set the return value and ouput arguments.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.OnMethodInvocationAspect.GetOptions
member.summary: Gets the weaving options.
member.returns: Weaving options.

member.summary: Internal. Utility methods used at runtime by assemblies modified by PostSharp Laos.

member.summary: Deserialize an object stored as a resource.
member.param: Assembly containing the resource.
Resource name.
member.returns: The deserialized object, or null if the resource could not be found.

member.name: T:PostSharp.Laos.OnExceptionAspect
member.summary: Custom attribute that, when applied to a method, defines an exception handler around the whole method and calls a custom method in this exception handler.

member.name: M:PostSharp.Laos.OnExceptionAspect.GetOptions
member.summary: Get the weaving options.
member.returns: The weaving options.
